skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.
Fighting upon an Arcane Phoenix, Teclis rides the magical tempests, harnessing the power of the howling Winds sweeping through the world of mortals.

enabled_if: Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

skillTree.localised_description: Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
With precise applications of unmaking, any threat may be rendered null and void in turn.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The utmost concentration, the greatest attention to detail, are required if the world is to be saved from the destructive madness of the Ruinous Ones.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Archmage crackles and flows with energies that would unmake any mortal practitioner.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +10
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: As master of the foremost Asur mages, this Elf has studied in their secret libraries longer than most men live.

effects.description:
Hero action success chance: +5% for Mages and Loremasters of Hoeth
	(all characters)

Hero action cost: -15% for Loremasters of Hoeth and Mages
	(all characters)

Ward save: 10% for Loremasters of Hoeth
	(all characters)

skillTree.localised_description: Teclis sets a fire within the very rock itself, causing the ground to splinter and the raging lifeblood of the world to gush forth and consume the enemy.
With a mighty bellow, the caster invokes Corvus the Crow Lord, summoning his servants to peck at the foe's eyes. Teclis is particularly adept at this art.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Wind Blast"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Wind Blast Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Wind Blast Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: Teclis traps his enemies in nets woven of heavenly light
At Teclis' command, the weapons of his soldiers flow like water and find every weakness of enemy armour and shields.
A Vortex of powerful magic, willed into existence by Teclis' indomitable will.

By speaking Druthandor's name the Wizard is able to heal allies' injuries much faster than by natural means. Teclis' has honed this ability to a point where he is able to bring back those recently deceased.
The caster utters words of power and a phoenix of pure fire manifests to swoop upon the enemy, bathing them in cleansing flame.
When everything else fails, there is always studying the blade. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)
Even the simplest of spells can bring forth the full bloom of renewal, reinvigorating and healing the broken and bleeding.
A conjured shadow is just as obfuscating as a real one - the Shadow Wizard is master or mistress of the 'concealing' arts.
The spellcaster attunes the magic of the wild, channelling its ancient and arcane power.

"The Realms of Man must not fall. Our fate is intertwined with theirs, and if they fall, so too do we. For this reason, I taught their first masters of magic, and for this reason, we must not abandon Men, despite their barbarous ways."

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -20% for all spells

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Turning an untrained bunch of regular citizens into effective fighting units requires a special kind of talent, and oodles of patience.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
“Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.”
The Lords rule, the peasants toil. Nothing has changed in over a thousand years.
This warrior has been ambushed previously and got themselves and many of their compatriots away safely. Such things make one naturally suspicious.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Far removed from the petty squabbles of other races, many High Elves are able to devote themselves to learning, magic and the arts.
This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

factionEffects.localised_description: Teclis is Tyrion's twin brother, but two more different siblings would be hard to find. Where the curse of Aenarion has yet to leave an obvious mark upon Tyrion, it has made his brother frail and caustic.

effects.description:

	(all armies)
Diplomatic relations: +15 with Men, High Elves, Wood Elves, Lizardmen and Dwarfs

Winds of Magic power reserve change: +5% when increasing

items.colour_text: The Moon Staff is imbued with the immortal power of the Goddess Lileath, eternally youthful daughter of Isha.

items.colour_text: Seldom seen outside the walls of the White Tower, the War Crown was given to Teclis by the former High Loremaster and holds great power.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This body may be frail, but never doubt the strength of the mind, or the heart within it.
